title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'thrilled' about latest Netflix update
description: A source close to the Sussexes speaks out about the "wild speculation" of the last few weeks.
content:
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are said to be "thrilled" to be able to "put rumours to bed" over their Netflix contract, sources have claimed. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have struck a new "multi-year first look" deal with the streaming giant, five years after their lucrative, exclusive one, reportedly worth around £74million, ended. The first-look deal, which means Netflix will have the first option on Harry and Meghan's projects, was described by the Sussexes as "extending their creative partnership". The latest announcement followed various reports claiming that Netflix would end up axing its partnership with the Montecito couple, following a series of flops. The Sussexes' most successful series has been Harry & Meghan - their controversial tell-all 2022 documentary about stepping back from royal duties and their struggles with the royal family.

Stay up-to-date with the latest Royal news Join us on WhatsApp Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

It totalled 23.4 million views and is Netflix's fifth most popular documentary series of all time. The rest of them, Live to Lead, Heart of Invictus, Polo and With Love Meghan, failed to attract similar views. But according to a source close to the couple, Harry and Meghan had to suffer through a "frustrating" silence after what was described as "wild and inaccurate speculation" in recent weeks. The source told GB News: "The couple are pretty thrilled with the deal. It’s been a long time in the planning."

"They’re over the moon. It’s great to be able to continue making great programmes with Netflix." They added: "It’s been frustrating, we haven’t been able to say too much and put [the rumours] to bed during contract negotiations. "Some of the reporting shows you how much wild and inaccurate speculation there is around the Duke and Duchess." The source said that the Sussexes are "still box office" and argued that Netflix "would not have renewed the deal" if they thought Harry and Meghan "wouldn't sell".
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have reportedly signed a new multi-year first-look deal with Netflix, five years after their previous exclusive one ended. The deal allows Netflix to have the first option on Harry and Markle's projects, despite reports of ending the partnership due to series of flops. The most successful series of the Sussexes, Harry & Meghan, is their controversial tell-all 2022 documentary about stepping back from royal duties and their struggles with the royal family. However, a source close to the couple stated that Netflix would not have renewed the deal if they believed Harry and Megan would not sell.
shortSummary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have secured a new multi-year Netflix deal, ending speculation about their future partnership, despite recent flops.

scraped_sources.text:
Meghan and Prince Harry delighted to ‘put rumours to bed’ after ‘frustrating’ silence
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex celebrated after 'a long time in the planning'
Don't Miss
Most Read
Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have celebrated the opportunity to "put rumours to bed" after suffering through a "frustrating" silence.
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex railed against what they described as "wild and inaccurate speculation" in recent weeks.
Their comments come as they announced a renewed deal with Netflix and a host of new projects with the US streaming giant.
**ARE YOU READING THIS ON OUR APP? DOWNLOAD NOW FOR THE BEST GB NEWS EXPERIENCE**
Speaking to GB News, a source close to the Sussexes said: "The couple are pretty thrilled with the deal. It’s been a long time in the planning."
Meghan and Prince Harry have shared their delight at being able to 'put rumours to bed'
|GETTY
"They’re over the moon. It’s great to be able to continue making great programmes with Netflix," they continued.
The source explained having to remain tight lipped about the news, amid speculation the deal may not be continued, had caused the couple distress.
"It’s been frustrating we haven’t been able to say too much and put [the rumours] to bed during contract negotiations," the insider added.
"Some of the reporting shows you how much wild and inaccurate speculation there is around the Duke and Duchess."
The Duke and Duchess shared their 'frustrations' with having to remain silent amid speculation about their Netflix deal
|GETTY
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex were also said to welcome to chance to put to right the apparent naysaying among elements of the press regarding their media ventures.
"Harry and Meghan are still box office despite what the British press might want to think, and prefer to promote a negative agenda," the source added.
"Netflix would not have renewed the deal if they thought The Duke and Duchess wouldn’t sell," the comments concluded.
On Monday, Netflix declared it would continue its "creative partnership" with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, through their production company Archewell, in a "multi-year, first look deal for film and television projects".
Netflix announced a new 'creative partnership' with Harry and Meghan
|GETTY
Thrilled about the announcement, the Duchess said: "We're proud to extend our partnership with Netflix and expand our work together to include the As Ever brand.
"My husband and I feel inspired by our partners who work closely with us and our Archewell Productions team to create thoughtful content across genres that resonates globally, and celebrates our shared vision," she added.
Bela Bajaria, Netflix’s Chief Content Officer, added: "Harry and Meghan are influential voices whose stories resonate with audiences everywhere.
LATEST ROYAL NEWS:
Meghan also shared she and Harry were 'proud' and 'inspired' to continue their work with Netflix
|GETTY
"The response to their work speaks for itself — Harry & Meghan gave viewers an intimate look into their lives and quickly became one of our most-watched documentary series.
"More recently, fans have been inspired by With Love, Meghan, with products from the new As Ever line consistently selling out in record time. We’re excited to continue our partnership with Archewell Productions and to entertain our members together."
The streaming company will also advance their partnership with Meghan's lifestyle brand, As Ever, and extend the current product range.

argos_summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have expressed their excitement over a new multi-year first-look deal with Netflix, allowing them to continue their creative partnership after previous speculation about the end of their collaboration. The couple, who described the recent period of silence amid contract negotiations as 'frustrating,' are pleased to dispel rumors regarding their media ventures. Their most successful project to date, the documentary 'Harry & Meghan,' has garnered significant viewership, reinforcing their appeal to audiences.
